content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

Here is an example of how you might implement this in Julia:

```julia
# Define your struct FloatWithUnits
struct FloatWithUnits
    value::Float64
    unit::String
end

# Write the show method for your struct
function Base.show(io::IO, fwu::FloatWithUnits)
    print(io, "$(fwu.value) $(fwu.unit)")
end
```

In this code, we define a `struct` FloatWithUnits with two fields: value and unit. We then provide a `show` method for the struct that prints the value and units in a space separated format. When you create an instance of FloatWithUnits and call show(io, instance), it will print "value unit".
